The House of Representatives passed a 2: 6 percent pay raise for all civilian federal employees in response to a government shutdown, indicating that federal workers are indeed paid above the household income in southern Missouri.
U: S. Rep. Jason Smith criticized the pay raise, stating that individuals in southern Missouri do not receive pay raises just for showing up to work.
Data from the U: S. Census Bureau and the Bureau of Economic Analysis support the claim that individual federal employees earn more than southern Missouri households.
The mean household income in Missouri is: 70,144, which is lower than the mean income of a federal civilian worker, which is $90,811.
